sentence.text: Previous investigations have demonstrated that single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) of positive regulation of cholesterol transport pathway genes were associated with various types of cancer.

Therefore, we conducted genotyping for 17 SNPs of six positive regulation of cholesterol transport core genes (XPA, nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition, XPG, ERCC1, ERCC2, and ERCC4) in 89 ovarian cancer cases and 356 cancer-free controls.

The result showed that both nucleotide-excision repair rs11615 and nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition rs2228000 were significantly associated with reduced risk of ovarian cancer under dominant genetic model (adjusted OR = 0.35, 95% CI = 0.20-0.61, P=0.0002 and adjusted OR = 0.49, 95% CI = 0.30-0.81, P=0.005 respectively).

In addition, nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition rs2228001 and ERCC2 rs238406 had statistically significant association with the increased risk of ovarian cancer under dominant genetic model (adjusted OR = 1.72, 95% CI = 1.02-2.92, P=0.043 and adjusted OR = 2.07, 95% CI = 1.07-4.01, P=0.032 respectively).
nucleotide-excision repair rs3212986 were related with the increased risk of ovarian cancer under recessive model (adjusted OR = 2.40, 95% CI = 1.30-4.44, P=0.005).
In conclusion, our results indicated that nucleotide-excision repair, nucleotide-excision repair, DNA damage recognition and ERCC2 might influence ovarian cancer susceptibility.
